Detailed Description

Internal abstract interface base class for OBEX transports.

Warning;
This is an internal interface and must not be used outside APOXI at all.

It must be implemented by all transport adapters, hence developers of transport adapters for APOXI OBEX will need to understand the concepts explained in the following paragraphs.

This class mainly serves the following purposes:

  • Abstraction of transport stack and underlying hardware.
    Each instance of a class derived from ObexAbstractTransport registers itself with the Transport Registry by calling Register() at startup time. It also becomes an observer of the related transport hardware abstraction and notifies OBEX servers and clients when the state of the hardware changes (for example, when an USB cable is plugged or infrared is turned off) by sending out an ObexTransportMsg.

  • Providing access to the stack-specific OBEX implementation.
    The GetProtocol() method must be implemented to return a pointer to the transport-specific OBEX implementation when ObexPrIdOpp is passed as actual parameter. Other protocols may be supported as well. The OBEX protocol implementation must provide an instance of a class derived from ObexLayer. This class is responsible for forwarding outbound events to the protocol stack and notifying incoming events to APOXI OBEX.

  • Address resolution for server- and client addresses.
    Server address resolution may involve checking the address for ambiguity and entering it into a database to advertise the offered service to remote devices (Bluetooth SDB, IrDA IRIAS). Client address resolution usually means service discovery and obtaining a logical address suitable for establishing a transport connection to a remote server.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef ObexTransportId ObexAbstractTransport::ObjectId
 

Unique id of a transport instance. The object id is assigned to the transport when it registers with the Transport Manager.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ObexAbstractTransport::ObexAbstractTransport (   )  [protected]
 

Restricts construction to derived classes.

As all transport implementations are supposed to be statically allocated singletons initialization is done by calling the Init() method.

virtual ObexProtocol* ObexAbstractTransport::GetProtocol (  ObexProtocolId  level  )  [pure virtual]
 

Provides access to the protocol layer object of the specified level.

Parameters:
level Protocol level / layer
Returns:
Pointer to object or '0' if protocol is unsupported.
Note: All transports must support at least ObexProtocol::ObexLevel !

Implemented in UsbObexTransport, BtObexTransport, and IrdaObexTransport.

void ObexAbstractTransport::Init (  AbstractTransport &  device_abs,
const CHAR *  scheme_url
)  [protected]
 

Initialization method restricted to derived classes.

Parameters:
scheme_url Scheme identifier from URL. The URL takes the form: <scheme>://<address>{,<options>}
device_abs Transport device abstraction object

Note: scheme_url must be unique among all transport implementations within the system, otherwise registration Register() will fail

Reimplemented in StreamObexTransport.

BOOLEAN ObexAbstractTransport::IsMatchedByUrl (  const String &  obex_url  )  const
 

Tells if the passed URL scheme matches the transport.

Returns:
'TRUE' When the 'scheme' within the URL equals the one associated with the transport or is the wildcard designator '*', 'FALSE' otherwise

void ObexAbstractTransport::OnUpdate (  ObservableObject *  obs_obj  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked when the state of the Observable-Object obs_obj has been changed. To get invoked by the Observable-Object the Observer must attach itself by ObservableObject::Attach(this).

Reimplemented from Observer.

Reimplemented in UsbObexTransport.

void ObexAbstractTransport::Register (   )  [protected]
 

Registers a transport implementation with the ObexMngr.

Should be called by every transport implementation at startup time, but only after initialization of internal objects has been completed.

virtual void ObexAbstractTransport::ResolveClientAddr (  const String &  remote_url,
ObexProtocolId  prot_id,
ObexOperationId  job_id
)  [pure virtual]
 

Resolves an OBEX client address URL.

This is a factory method which evaluates the URL given in string format and creates an address information object which may contain specific information for the transport. This is accomplished by deriving a subclass from ObexClientAddr and creating an address information object from this class. Then a smartpointer of type ObexAddrPtr to this object and the job_id which was supplied with the URL must be returned by calling ReturnObexAddress().

Parameters:
remote_url Remote address in URL format - the URL the client is going to connect to.
prot_id Protocol which will be bound to the address
job_id Reference to associate request and response

Implemented in UsbObexTransport, BtObexTransport, and IrdaObexTransport.

virtual void ObexAbstractTransport::ResolveServerAddr (  const String &  local_url,
ObexProtocolId  prot_id,
BOOLEAN  sdb_autocreate,
ObexOperationId  job_id
)  [pure virtual]
 

Resolves an OBEX server address URL.

This is a factory method which evaluates the URL given in string format and creates an address information object which may contain specific information for the transport. This is accomplished by deriving a subclass from ObexServerAddr and creating an address information object from this class. Then a smartpointer of type ObexAddrPtr to this object and the job_id which was supplied with the URL must be returned by calling ReturnObexAddress().

Parameters:
local_url Local server address in URL format - the URL the server is going to listen on.
prot_id Protocol which will be bound to the address
sdb_autocreate Check whether address can be autoregistered
job_id Reference to associate request and response

Implemented in UsbObexTransport, BtObexTransport, and IrdaObexTransport.

void ObexAbstractTransport::ReturnObexAddress (  const ObexAddrPtr &  addr_ptr,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
ObexResult  result
)  [protected]
 

Return an OBEX address to the requester asynchronously.

Parameters:
addr_ptr ObexAddrPtr which holds the ObexAddress instance to be delivered.
oper_id Associated Operation Id which was passed to ResolveClientAddr() or ResolveServerAddr()
result ObexResult::Ok() should be passed when URL parsing has produced a valid address instance. Otherwise, addr_ptr should be left empty (pass ObexAddrPtr()) and the result should indicate an appropriate error cause.
